column1: confirmed in Urban Development Authority v. Ceylon Entertainments Limited and others
[(2004) 1 Sri.L.R. 95 at 98] where Edussuriya J. held:
“[…]  where an  objection is taken on the ground that either  the originals or duly
certified copies of material documents have not been filed with the petition then
the Court of Appeal must before making a ruling on such objection consider the
question whether such documents are material in deciding the questions urged
by the petitioner in the application […]” (emphasis added)
